title: Removes department of labor from management of strategic training alliance program
summary: Removes the department of labor from the management of the strategic training alliance program operated by the state urban development corporation; authorizes the provision of assistance under such program to eligible training providers; limits to 5% the portion of assistance which may be used for administrative costs.
lawSection: New York State Urban Development Corporation Act

       AN ACT to amend the urban development corporation act and the labor law,
         in relation to eliminating the department of labor from the management

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-

    4    S 16-j. Strategic  training  alliance  program.  1.  Program  created.
    5  Pursuant  to  this  section [and article 24-A of the labor law] there is
    6  hereby established within the corporation [and the department of  labor]
    7  a  strategic  training alliance program to identify and address employer
    8  demands for skilled workers. The  corporation  [and  the  department  of
    9  labor]  may  cooperate  with the department of economic development, the
   10  state university of New York, the  city  university  of  New  York,  THE
   11  DEPARTMENT  OF  LABOR,  and the state education department, in providing
   12  support within amounts available for the program for training activities
   13  by an eligible applicant which is defined as an employer or an  employer
   14  in  conjunction  with  a  labor  organization,  a  strategic alliance or
   15  network or association of employers with common problems or concerns,  a
   16  private  industry council established pursuant to the federal job train-
   17  ing partnership act (P.L. 97-300) [or],  one  or  more  local  workforce
   18  investment  boards established pursuant to the federal workforce invest-
   19  ment act (P.L. 105-300) OR AN ELIGIBLE TRAINING PROVIDER representing  a
   20  strategic alliance.
   21    2.  Project  plans. (a) Project plans shall be submitted to the corpo-
   22  ration [or the department of labor] by applicants.  The corporation [and

   35    (i) not less than twenty percent of the  program  funds  are  used  in
   36  support  of  projects that assist small businesses as defined in section
   37  [one hundred thirty-one] 131 of the economic development law; and
   38    (ii) not less than twenty percent of program funds are used in support
   39  of projects that assist strategic alliances or networks or  associations
   40  of employers with common problems or concerns.
   41    (c)  The  corporation [and the department of labor] may within amounts
   42  available for the program provide  additional  funds  for  regional  and

   45    4.  Report  and evaluation. (a) The corporation [and the department of

   50    (b)  The  corporation [and the department of labor] shall also provide

   52  and  every  three  years  after.    The cost of such evaluation shall be

    1    S  850.  Legislative  findings  and  objectives. The federal Workforce
